GOD.content: to know thyself, misunderstanding of knowledge, doesn’t know the secret
GOD.linkedContent: to know thyself, misunderstanding of knowledge, doesn’t know the secret

GOD.content: secret of secrecy: we have no knowledge of it, and it is there for no one (et qu’il n’est là pour personne), a secret doesn’t belong, never at home or in its place (chez soi)
GOD.linkedContent: secret of secrecy: we have no knowledge of it, and it is there for no one (et qu’il n’est là pour personne), a secret doesn’t belong, never at home or in its place (chez soi)

GOD.content: what’s the sense of saying “my” secret, if the secret can only be revealed au tout autre
GOD.linkedContent: what’s the sense of saying “my” secret, if the secret can only be revealed au tout autre

GT.content: condition of knowing, desire to know (ēpistemē, historia rerum gestarum) [which Derrida relates to the possibility of narration], gives rise to history itself (res gestae, Geschehen, Geschichte)
GT.linkedContent: condition of knowing, desire to know (ēpistemē, historia rerum gestarum) [which Derrida relates to the possibility of narration], gives rise to history itself (res gestae, Geschehen, Geschichte)

FK.content: “religion” involved in reacting antagonistically, re-affirmatively outbidding itself > in this place knowledge & faith bound to each other by band of their opposition
FK.linkedContent: “religion” involved in reacting antagonistically, re-affirmatively outbidding itself > in this place knowledge & faith bound to each other by band of their opposition

FK.content: temptation of knowledge: to believe not only in what one knows one knows but to know, have faith, in what knowledge is
FK.linkedContent: temptation of knowledge: to believe not only in what one knows one knows but to know, have faith, in what knowledge is

FK.content: the scholar’s (Benveniste’s) scruple, assurance and also hesitation, between the proper meaning and its other > quasi-automatic, machine-like, also religious: restraint of response
FK.linkedContent: the scholar’s (Benveniste’s) scruple, assurance and also hesitation, between the proper meaning and its other > quasi-automatic, machine-like, also religious: restraint of response

FK.content: pure knowledge, pure know-how: annulment of the future
FK.linkedContent: pure knowledge, pure know-how: annulment of the future

FK.content: knowledge & faith, technoscience & religion, alliance of calculable and incalculable
FK.linkedContent: knowledge & faith, technoscience & religion, alliance of calculable and incalculable

FK.content: growing disproportion btwn knowledge &. know-how (use of artifacts/protheses of which one is totally ignorant)
FK.linkedContent: growing disproportion btwn knowledge &. know-how (use of artifacts/protheses of which one is totally ignorant)

POO.content: testimony never reducible to proof, verification, demonstration > knowledge [cf. F p. xxvii]
POO.linkedContent: testimony never reducible to proof, verification, demonstration > knowledge [cf. F p. xxvii]

SPOM.content: no progress of knowledge could saturate the opening which has no knowledge
SPOM.linkedContent: no progress of knowledge could saturate the opening which has no knowledge

POR.content: via Aristotle, knowledge as knowing to learn and to teach
POR.linkedContent: via Aristotle, knowledge as knowing to learn and to teach

POR.content: sight is privileged sense re: knowledge, knowing for sake of knowing linked to sight as senseless sensation (sight privileged even when no praxis in view)
POR.linkedContent: sight is privileged sense re: knowledge, knowing for sake of knowing linked to sight as senseless sensation (sight privileged even when no praxis in view)

A.content: to protect decision or responsibility by knowledge, theoretical assurance, is to transform this experience into deployment of program
A.linkedContent: to protect decision or responsibility by knowledge, theoretical assurance, is to transform this experience into deployment of program

SEC.content: Husserl’s interest is in purely logical grammar not pure grammar > “the green is or,” unacceptable in context determined by a will to know, still signifies an example of agrammaticality
SEC.linkedContent: Husserl’s interest is in purely logical grammar not pure grammar > “the green is or,” unacceptable in context determined by a will to know, still signifies an example of agrammaticality

PP.content: writing linked to myth, both contra knowledge (sought w/in oneself)
PP.linkedContent: writing linked to myth, both contra knowledge (sought w/in oneself)

PP.content: writing as repeating w/out knowing (through a myth [?])
PP.linkedContent: writing as repeating w/out knowing (through a myth [?])

PP.content: Socrates must renounce knowledge as power, passion and pleasure, must consent to die, let his body die, to achieve alētheia, epistēmē, which are also powers
PP.linkedContent: Socrates must renounce knowledge as power, passion and pleasure, must consent to die, let his body die, to achieve alētheia, epistēmē, which are also powers

PP.content: dialectical inversion of pharmakon or dangerous supplement makes death à la fois acceptable and null > immortality of soul, acts like antibody, dissipates its terrifying fantasy, le pharmarkon inverti, qui met en fuite tous les épouvantails: origin of epistēmē, opening to truth as possibility of repetition, submission of “greed for life (epithumein zēn)” to law (king, father, chief, capital)
PP.linkedContent: dialectical inversion of pharmakon or dangerous supplement makes death à la fois acceptable and null > immortality of soul, acts like antibody, dissipates its terrifying fantasy, le pharmarkon inverti, qui met en fuite tous les épouvantails: origin of epistēmē, opening to truth as possibility of repetition, submission of “greed for life (epithumein zēn)” to law (king, father, chief, capital)

PP.content: knowledge, epistēmē, antidote: remaining measured against hubris, cet entraînment démesuré qui emporte l’être dans le simulacre, le masque et la fête
PP.linkedContent: knowledge, epistēmē, antidote: remaining measured against hubris, cet entraînment démesuré qui emporte l’être dans le simulacre, le masque et la fête

PP.content: le père est, le père est (le fils perdu), writing, father is not, suspends question “what is?” > which is always “what is the father?”
PP.linkedContent: le père est, le père est (le fils perdu), writing, father is not, suspends question “what is?” > which is always “what is the father?”

VP.content: idea of knowledge and theory of knowledge are metaphysical?
is sign not the sole thing which falls outside question “what is?” while producing this question
VP.linkedContent: is sign not the sole thing which falls outside question “what is?” while producing this question

VP.content: knowledge as norm, intuition adequate to its object, already opened by promise, telos, in truth, the pro-visional [difference btwn intuition/intention] as essence of meaning (vouloir-dire), discourse adheres to discursive essence when false, attains its entelechy when true
VP.linkedContent: knowledge as norm, intuition adequate to its object, already opened by promise, telos, in truth, the pro-visional [difference btwn intuition/intention] as essence of meaning (vouloir-dire), discourse adheres to discursive essence when false, attains its entelechy when true

VP.content: “pure logical grammar” > le sens n’attend pas la vérité insofar as it expects it (en tant qu’il l’attend)
VP.linkedContent: “pure logical grammar” > le sens n’attend pas la vérité insofar as it expects it (en tant qu’il l’attend)

VP.content: [Husserl’s formalism, his “pure logical grammar,” limited by semantic theme, the sense determined on basis of relation to object > telos of epistemological rationality is irreducible origin of idea of pure grammar?]
VP.linkedContent: [Husserl’s formalism, his “pure logical grammar,” limited by semantic theme, the sense determined on basis of relation to object > telos of epistemological rationality is irreducible origin of idea of pure grammar?]

PAS.content: what does one know of force of de-distancing? and if the custody (garde) of knowledge is distanced? word knowledge would be refolded, re-employed > Blanchot’s reploiement formidable
PAS.linkedContent: what does one know of force of de-distancing? and if the custody (garde) of knowledge is distanced? word knowledge would be refolded, re-employed > Blanchot’s reploiement formidable

PAS.content: the gift w/out knowing (sans le savoir), the sole possible, the impossible
PAS.linkedContent: the gift w/out knowing (sans le savoir), the sole possible, the impossible

S.content: Valéry: knowledge devours everything, turns all to ash
S.linkedContent: Valéry: knowledge devours everything, turns all to ash

FSW.content: repression of writing since Plato constitutes philosophy as epistēmē: truth as unity of logos and phonē > deconstruction of logocentrism not psychoanalysis of philosophy
FSW.linkedContent: repression of writing since Plato constitutes philosophy as epistēmē: truth as unity of logos and phonē > deconstruction of logocentrism not psychoanalysis of philosophy

PPHS.content: “why” no longer marks question of “en-vue-de-quoi,” re: telos/eskhaton of signification, nor is it a question of origin
PPHS.linkedContent: “why” no longer marks question of “en-vue-de-quoi,” re: telos/eskhaton of signification, nor is it a question of origin

POOF.content: for Aristotle, friendship linked to knowledge, science & self-consciousness held (tenue) in pledge, alliance, promise, performative chain [of friendship]
POOF.linkedContent: for Aristotle, friendship linked to knowledge, science & self-consciousness held (tenue) in pledge, alliance, promise, performative chain [of friendship]

POOF.content: for Aristotle, a friend chooses knowing rather than being known, counts, refers, prefers, chooses to love > irreducible difference btwn active/passive, c’est elle qui compte et permet de compter
POOF.linkedContent: for Aristotle, a friend chooses knowing rather than being known, counts, refers, prefers, chooses to love > irreducible difference btwn active/passive, c’est elle qui compte et permet de compter

POOF.content: Nietzsche’s interruption no longer the knowledge of the dying sage
POOF.linkedContent: Nietzsche’s interruption no longer the knowledge of the dying sage

POOF.content: the disproportion of sovereign friendship, the bond, trust [credit], faith marks rupture of knowing & loving, reason & affect > if the knowledge we have of each other is equally shared, it’s shared in glass of a mirror, autonomous on both sides, ce bris du miroir est bien le signe qu’à l'autre mon amitié se tend et se tient > passion & heteronomy [still Aristotelian topos?]
POOF.linkedContent: the disproportion of sovereign friendship, the bond, trust [credit], faith marks rupture of knowing & loving, reason & affect > if the knowledge we have of each other is equally shared, it’s shared in glass of a mirror, autonomous on both sides, ce bris du miroir est bien le signe qu’à l'autre mon amitié se tend et se tient > passion & heteronomy [still Aristotelian topos?]

POOF.content: question “What is (tí estin) friendship?” & “Who is the friend (either sex)?” is nothing but the question “What is philosophy?”
POOF.linkedContent: question “What is (tí estin) friendship?” & “Who is the friend (either sex)?” is nothing but the question “What is philosophy?”

POOF.content: [offering quasi-summary of HERP] moment that originary [Heraclitean] phileîn (accord, favour, solicitude Gunst) becomes jealous, nostalgic tension ‘determined by Eros [órexis]’: the step to philosophy, prepared by sophistry [Plato, Socrates] > is the strange voice of the friend, an ontological call [prior to subject, consciousness, even to Mitsein? see p. 243], interior & w/out, the “what is…?” of philosophy [?]
POOF.linkedContent: [offering quasi-summary of HERP] moment that originary [Heraclitean] phileîn (accord, favour, solicitude Gunst) becomes jealous, nostalgic tension ‘determined by Eros [órexis]’: the step to philosophy, prepared by sophistry [Plato, Socrates] > is the strange voice of the friend, an ontological call [prior to subject, consciousness, even to Mitsein? see p. 243], interior & w/out, the “what is…?” of philosophy [?]

POOF.content: as always for Heidegger, the gathering of lógos prevails, even if it accords the tensions of a false note
POOF.linkedContent: as always for Heidegger, the gathering of lógos prevails, even if it accords the tensions of a false note

POOF.content: possibility of question “what is…?”, anterior affirmation, not presented as present-being, future anteriority of “O my friends…”
POOF.linkedContent: possibility of question “what is…?”, anterior affirmation, not presented as present-being, future anteriority of “O my friends…”

POOF.content: temporal torsion [O my friend, no friend, contretemps], dissymmetry envelops theoretical knowledge in performativity of prayer it could never exhaust, we return to question of the response
POOF.linkedContent: temporal torsion [O my friend, no friend, contretemps], dissymmetry envelops theoretical knowledge in performativity of prayer it could never exhaust, we return to question of the response

SH.content: question “what is…[a date]?” is finite, signed, engaged, by a place, time, language(s)
SH.linkedContent: question “what is…[a date]?” is finite, signed, engaged, by a place, time, language(s)
philosophical regime that “what is?” governs

F.content: self: a cemetery guard (crypt is enclosed w/in self as excluded), self makes rounds (round & round) of crypt like he’s the proprietor, but he’s not, uses knowledge to keep visitors away
F.linkedContent: self: a cemetery guard (crypt is enclosed w/in self as excluded), self makes rounds (round & round) of crypt like he’s the proprietor, but he’s not, uses knowledge to keep visitors away

FWT.content: [re: extremely difficult to think the event w/ the machine] taking account of event (that which defies accounting), knowing how not to ignore/deny it, is knowledge too, scientific responsibility [giving account (reddere rationem, logon didonai)]
FWT.linkedContent: [re: extremely difficult to think the event w/ the machine] taking account of event (that which defies accounting), knowing how not to ignore/deny it, is knowledge too, scientific responsibility [giving account (reddere rationem, logon didonai)]

FWT.content: must be a leap from knowledge to decision, doesn’t take place w/out other, “passive” decision, decision of other, this doesn’t exonerate me [Derrida can prove this rationally, in the name of reason to come] > still necessary to know as much as possible before deciding
FWT.linkedContent: must be a leap from knowledge to decision, doesn’t take place w/out other, “passive” decision, decision of other, this doesn’t exonerate me [Derrida can prove this rationally, in the name of reason to come] > still necessary to know as much as possible before deciding

FWT.content: psychoanalytic aim > not to seek refuge in a theological/humanist alibi > Derrida seduced by psychoanalysis’ audacity of thought, its courage, signing theoretical “fictions” in name of a knowledge w/out alibi (thus, the most “positive” knowledge”)
FWT.linkedContent: psychoanalytic aim > not to seek refuge in a theological/humanist alibi > Derrida seduced by psychoanalysis’ audacity of thought, its courage, signing theoretical “fictions” in name of a knowledge w/out alibi (thus, the most “positive” knowledge”)

P.content: nonknowledge is point of view whose irreducibility gives rise to the beautiful (purity of the trace of the sans) > Kant: no science of the beautiful, only critique
P.linkedContent: nonknowledge is point of view whose irreducibility gives rise to the beautiful (purity of the trace of the sans) > Kant: no science of the beautiful, only critique

P.content: acc. Kant, pleasure of knowing (which once existed in a time immemorial [absolute past in a Critique?]), a pleasure of the same—mastery of dissimilar, reduction of heterogenous
P.linkedContent: acc. Kant, pleasure of knowing (which once existed in a time immemorial [absolute past in a Critique?]), a pleasure of the same—mastery of dissimilar, reduction of heterogenous

ROP.content: what is getting archived, the trace arriving to efface itself, beyond presence & absence, is impossible to know—not the order of knowledge
ROP.linkedContent: what is getting archived, the trace arriving to efface itself, beyond presence & absence, is impossible to know—not the order of knowledge

SP.content: can no longer ask “what is property?” > because propriation, a sexual operation, before which we didn’t know sexuality [?], is undecidable, more powerful than ti esti, than veil of truth, meaning of being—it organized all ontological statements > l’histoire (de la) vérité (est) un procès de propriation
SP.linkedContent: can no longer ask “what is property?” > because propriation, a sexual operation, before which we didn’t know sexuality [?], is undecidable, more powerful than ti esti, than veil of truth, meaning of being—it organized all ontological statements > l’histoire (de la) vérité (est) un procès de propriation

OTO.content: painfully difficult for life to become object of science, would require a philosophy of life, a whole politics, which inscribes the bio-graphical w/in the bio-logical
OTO.linkedContent: painfully difficult for life to become object of science, would require a philosophy of life, a whole politics, which inscribes the bio-graphical w/in the bio-logical

OTO.content: not the same for science of nonlife, of the dead, wins its claim to scientificity w/out delay: the co-implication btwn scientific object & the dead concerns desire to know
OTO.linkedContent: not the same for science of nonlife, of the dead, wins its claim to scientificity w/out delay: the co-implication btwn scientific object & the dead concerns desire to know

FS.content: no knowledge can keep writing from its essential precipitation toward meaning (which writing constitutes, which is writing’s future)
FS.linkedContent: no knowledge can keep writing from its essential precipitation toward meaning (which writing constitutes, which is writing’s future)

DIF.content: answer to “what is differance?” (w/out turning question back on itself) would reassert MOP
DIF.linkedContent: answer to “what is differance?” (w/out turning question back on itself) would reassert MOP

SW.content: no chance of s’avoir (belonging to oneself) > you’ll end up in imminence > un-veiling still movement of veil: a disappearing, drawing aside, to let something be seen, let be, to let
SW.linkedContent: no chance of s’avoir (belonging to oneself) > you’ll end up in imminence > un-veiling still movement of veil: a disappearing, drawing aside, to let something be seen, let be, to let

SW.content: wait w/out horizon & someone else one knows too well, “even me why not,” an other yet to be born, who strikes dumb order of knowledge > too well-known, stranger head to foot
SW.linkedContent: wait w/out horizon & someone else one knows too well, “even me why not,” an other yet to be born, who strikes dumb order of knowledge > too well-known, stranger head to foot

RGE.content: Bataille: man who sacrifices vs. sage who surrenders to knowledge
RGE.linkedContent: Bataille: man who sacrifices vs. sage who surrenders to knowledge

RGE.content: discursive knowledge is neutral, neutrality has a negative essence (ne-uter), negative side of transgression
RGE.linkedContent: discursive knowledge is neutral, neutrality has a negative essence (ne-uter), negative side of transgression

DST.content: epochē sets, suspends, in parentheses > what do epochs of “What is…?” have to do, or not to do, w/ madness?
DST.linkedContent: epochē sets, suspends, in parentheses > what do epochs of “What is…?” have to do, or not to do, w/ madness?

PIO.content: grasp unity of 2 measures of invention: 1) fabula/fictio: art 2) tekhnē, epistemē, istoria, methodos, art, know-how, procedure, knowledge, research
PIO.linkedContent: grasp unity of 2 measures of invention: 1) fabula/fictio: art 2) tekhnē, epistemē, istoria, methodos, art, know-how, procedure, knowledge, research

PIO.content: if one draws a [historical] dividing line btwn use of word “invention,” must do so w/in great/fundamental reference to human tekhnē, this mythopoetic power that associates fable w/ historical, epistemic narrative [Foucault +/–]
PIO.linkedContent: if one draws a [historical] dividing line btwn use of word “invention,” must do so w/in great/fundamental reference to human tekhnē, this mythopoetic power that associates fable w/ historical, epistemic narrative [Foucault +/–]

PIO.content: circa 17-century (btwn Descartes & Leibniz), invention becomes technoscientific, production of independent, self-reproductive recurrence, capable of reiterative simulation, a dispositif
PIO.linkedContent: circa 17-century (btwn Descartes & Leibniz), invention becomes technoscientific, production of independent, self-reproductive recurrence, capable of reiterative simulation, a dispositif

HLP.content: phenomenon of lie intrinsically foreign to problem of knowledge (irreducibly ethical dimension)
HLP.linkedContent: phenomenon of lie intrinsically foreign to problem of knowledge (irreducibly ethical dimension)

HLP.content: (in principle and in its classical determination) a lie is not an error
HLP.linkedContent: (in principle and in its classical determination) a lie is not an error

TR.content: confession not of order of knowledge, of making known; Augustine wonders why he must confess to God, who knows everything > answer: to convert fault into love [Nietzsche]
TR.linkedContent: confession not of order of knowledge, of making known; Augustine wonders why he must confess to God, who knows everything > answer: to convert fault into love [Nietzsche]

TR.content: confession not a truth to be revealed but a truth to be “made,” to be “verified”
TR.linkedContent: confession not a truth to be revealed but a truth to be “made,” to be “verified”

TR.content: de Man’s “twilight zone btwn knowing & not-knowing” consubstantial w/ confession
TR.linkedContent: de Man’s “twilight zone btwn knowing & not-knowing” consubstantial w/ confession

AFR.content: Derrida defends Condillac against Foucault’s assessment of a “deficiency,” “epistemological myths” > perhaps Condillac’s maintenance of calculus & genesis resists a classical opposition; Derrida then notes [re: relevance to scientific modernity]: imaginary upsurging of one epistēmē, its finitude, table, sets terrain for theory of general epistēmē, which makes table its determining norm [see Bennington’s Scatter p. 11]
AFR.linkedContent: Derrida defends Condillac against Foucault’s assessment of a “deficiency,” “epistemological myths” > perhaps Condillac’s maintenance of calculus & genesis resists a classical opposition; Derrida then notes [re: relevance to scientific modernity]: imaginary upsurging of one epistēmē, its finitude, table, sets terrain for theory of general epistēmē, which makes table its determining norm [see Bennington’s Scatter p. 11]

AFR.content: invention of a new science: “new combinations” exist (new science at once example and discovery of this) > generative or combinative model (separately) insufficient
AFR.linkedContent: invention of a new science: “new combinations” exist (new science at once example and discovery of this) > generative or combinative model (separately) insufficient

AFR.content: for Condillac, degree, gradual difference, ruins “identical proposition,” dislocates is > yet, degree also makes synthesis of “identical proposition” possible (prohibiting frivolity, advancing knowledge)
AFR.linkedContent: for Condillac, degree, gradual difference, ruins “identical proposition,” dislocates is > yet, degree also makes synthesis of “identical proposition” possible (prohibiting frivolity, advancing knowledge)

IW.content: [vis-à-vis Cohen] how Gewissheit (certainty) connects w/ Wissenschaft, Gewissen, Selbstbewusstsein—knowledge/faith come together in German Protestantism > culture/scientific conscience of modern peoples founded on 2 types of Gewissheit (knowledge/faith)
IW.linkedContent: [vis-à-vis Cohen] how Gewissheit (certainty) connects w/ Wissenschaft, Gewissen, Selbstbewusstsein—knowledge/faith come together in German Protestantism > culture/scientific conscience of modern peoples founded on 2 types of Gewissheit (knowledge/faith)

TN.content: via de Biran, sense of “I” comes from hand: rough, too heavy resistance > he would know nothing about himself, if he did not experience resistance
TN.linkedContent: via de Biran, sense of “I” comes from hand: rough, too heavy resistance > he would know nothing about himself, if he did not experience resistance

NOY.content: de Certeau: knowledge’s procedure is essentially a “no,” mystic postulate advances a limitless “yes”
NOY.linkedContent: de Certeau: knowledge’s procedure is essentially a “no,” mystic postulate advances a limitless “yes”

NOY.content: St. Paul: “in Him there has been only Yes (nai)” > de Certeau: this “yes” pierces field of distinctions/separations practiced by Hebraic epistemology
NOY.linkedContent: St. Paul: “in Him there has been only Yes (nai)” > de Certeau: this “yes” pierces field of distinctions/separations practiced by Hebraic epistemology

E.content: for Kant, science is not art, has no beauty in it, because no pleasure can be taken in it
E.linkedContent: for Kant, science is not art, has no beauty in it, because no pleasure can be taken in it

E.content: yet, in his Introduction, he claims that in an immemorial past, pleasure could not be separated from knowledge, so the Witz (bon mot), the only scientific pleasure, carries this repressed past in it
E.linkedContent: yet, in his Introduction, he claims that in an immemorial past, pleasure could not be separated from knowledge, so the Witz (bon mot), the only scientific pleasure, carries this repressed past in it

E.content: question “what is?”: offers a paregoric parergon, constructs framework to capture energy of unassimilable, it softens, remedies, w/ speech, consoles, exhorts w/ the word
E.linkedContent: question “what is?”: offers a paregoric parergon, constructs framework to capture energy of unassimilable, it softens, remedies, w/ speech, consoles, exhorts w/ the word

BSi.content: a seminar that teaches knowledge must be w/out fable
BSi.linkedContent: a seminar that teaches knowledge must be w/out fable

BSi.content: fable, for, fari, to speak, to say, fabula, something said > make so as to know: 1) bring knowledge to the other 2) give impression, effect, of knowledge, of knowing, simulacrum of knowing: a savoir-faire to “faire” savoir where there is no knowing worthy of the name
BSi.linkedContent: fable, for, fari, to speak, to say, fabula, something said > make so as to know: 1) bring knowledge to the other 2) give impression, effect, of knowledge, of knowing, simulacrum of knowing: a savoir-faire to “faire” savoir where there is no knowing worthy of the name

BSi.content: “storytelling,” convention of some historical as if, fabular > a moral lesson, a political strategy, pedagogical artifice to credit a fable: to make known (political logic, rhetoric)
BSi.linkedContent: “storytelling,” convention of some historical as if, fabular > a moral lesson, a political strategy, pedagogical artifice to credit a fable: to make known (political logic, rhetoric)

BSi.content: “how is a synthetic a priori possible?” and Deleuze’s “how is bêtise (and not error) possible?”: transcendental questions of possibility > but, Deleuze’s question removes possibility from epistemological economy, from determination of Being, from objectivity of object
BSi.linkedContent: “how is a synthetic a priori possible?” and Deleuze’s “how is bêtise (and not error) possible?”: transcendental questions of possibility > but, Deleuze’s question removes possibility from epistemological economy, from determination of Being, from objectivity of object

BSi.content: in Celan, “perhaps’s” withdraw poem from dimension/authority of knowledge
BSi.linkedContent: in Celan, “perhaps’s” withdraw poem from dimension/authority of knowledge

BSi.content: poetic revolution (beyond sovereignty [?]), revolution in revolution—minuscule dethroning of majesty exceeds knowledge > signed by repetition of “perhaps’s,” “who knows”
BSi.linkedContent: poetic revolution (beyond sovereignty [?]), revolution in revolution—minuscule dethroning of majesty exceeds knowledge > signed by repetition of “perhaps’s,” “who knows”

BSi.content: “beast & sovereign” as an incitement to think limits of knowledge (horizon that will constantly border but also un-border)
BSi.linkedContent: “beast & sovereign” as an incitement to think limits of knowledge (horizon that will constantly border but also un-border)

BSi.content: “perhaps,” “who knows,” as link, separating hyphen btwn beast & sovereign, inviting us, w/out ordering us, to go over the limit of knowledge
BSi.linkedContent: “perhaps,” “who knows,” as link, separating hyphen btwn beast & sovereign, inviting us, w/out ordering us, to go over the limit of knowledge

BSi.content: knowledge no stranger to power, power no stranger to seeing, having, willing > autopsic/autoptic knowledge: take power over object of knowledge
BSi.linkedContent: knowledge no stranger to power, power no stranger to seeing, having, willing > autopsic/autoptic knowledge: take power over object of knowledge

BSi.content: zoos profitable to knowledge and economy [physiocratic theory of economy]
scene, theater, visibility of autopsy: violence of light > energeia of seeing, knowing
BSi.linkedContent: scene, theater, visibility of autopsy: violence of light > energeia of seeing, knowing

BSi.content: [during spectacle of autopsy/sovereignty] an éclat > fragment of light touches everything
BSi.linkedContent: [during spectacle of autopsy/sovereignty] an éclat > fragment of light touches everything

BSi.content: globalization of autopsic model, knowledge that de-vitalizes by looking at life (simple objectification) > the 2 senses of autopsia: cadaver & divine power
BSi.linkedContent: globalization of autopsic model, knowledge that de-vitalizes by looking at life (simple objectification) > the 2 senses of autopsia: cadaver & divine power

OG.content: rigorous investigation beyond closure of knowledge, take positivity of science to its limits—monstrous, breaks absolutely w/ normality > faithful to l’avenir (for which there is yet no exergue [chapter title: exergue])
OG.linkedContent: rigorous investigation beyond closure of knowledge, take positivity of science to its limits—monstrous, breaks absolutely w/ normality > faithful to l’avenir (for which there is yet no exergue [chapter title: exergue])

OG.content: history and knowledge (istoria and epistémè) > detours for the purpose of (en vue de) reappropriating presence
OG.linkedContent: history and knowledge (istoria and epistémè) > detours for the purpose of (en vue de) reappropriating presence

OG.content: to the question “what is the sign?” the answer has always been the signified, which is never contemporary, proximity to logos as phonè—presence: no relation to trace, signifier
OG.linkedContent: to the question “what is the sign?” the answer has always been the signified, which is never contemporary, proximity to logos as phonè—presence: no relation to trace, signifier

OG.content: what if sign escapes the instituting question of philosophy: “what is (ti esti)…?” what if we can only think of the sign as (is) [crossed-out] and (thing) [crossed-out, fixerup]? [Heidegger’s crossing-out]
OG.linkedContent: what if sign escapes the instituting question of philosophy: “what is (ti esti)…?” what if we can only think of the sign as (is) [crossed-out] and (thing) [crossed-out, fixerup]? [Heidegger’s crossing-out]

OG.content: if writing is mere “figuration” of language—it is exiled, cast outside, a double > unrelated to interior of the system: “internal system” is an epistemological exigency constituted by possibility of phonetic writing
OG.linkedContent: if writing is mere “figuration” of language—it is exiled, cast outside, a double > unrelated to interior of the system: “internal system” is an epistemological exigency constituted by possibility of phonetic writing

OG.content: but this science [deconstructive grammatology?], where opening of “image” conditions “reality,” can’t maintain classical scientific grid: external/internal, image/reality, representation/presence > this science inaugurates the originality of its field
OG.linkedContent: but this science [deconstructive grammatology?], where opening of “image” conditions “reality,” can’t maintain classical scientific grid: external/internal, image/reality, representation/presence > this science inaugurates the originality of its field

OG.content: science, asleep, uncritical re: tradition it inherits, this sleep the assured means of breaching (d’entamer) the deconstruction of la plus grande totalité: epistémè, metaphysical logocentrism
OG.linkedContent: science, asleep, uncritical re: tradition it inherits, this sleep the assured means of breaching (d’entamer) the deconstruction of la plus grande totalité: epistémè, metaphysical logocentrism

OG.content: deconstruction clarifies dream rather than allowing itself to be clarified by it [?]
OG.linkedContent: deconstruction clarifies dream rather than allowing itself to be clarified by it [?]

OG.content: grammatology’s condition of possibility, the solicitation of logocentrism, is condition of impossibility, risks destroying concept of science, exorbitant aim (visée) beyond savoir
OG.linkedContent: grammatology’s condition of possibility, the solicitation of logocentrism, is condition of impossibility, risks destroying concept of science, exorbitant aim (visée) beyond savoir

OG.content: question of origin merges w/ essence [re: what is writing?]
OG.linkedContent: question of origin merges w/ essence [re: what is writing?]

OG.content: trace is nothing, exceeds question “what is?” > no longer sheltered in grammatological knowledge: no longer assurance of opposition fait/droit > no pure fait
OG.linkedContent: trace is nothing, exceeds question “what is?” > no longer sheltered in grammatological knowledge: no longer assurance of opposition fait/droit > no pure fait

OG.content: writing as eclipse that surprises/obscures glory of word [cf. GLAS, faulty tele-type], dislocates founding categories of language & grammar of epistémè ——in contrast, theory, what unites science & philosophy in epistémè, tends toward filling in the breach rather than toward forcing the closure (plutôt à colmater les brèches qu’à forcer la clôture)
OG.linkedContent: writing as eclipse that surprises/obscures glory of word [cf. GLAS, faulty tele-type], dislocates founding categories of language & grammar of epistémè ——in contrast, theory, what unites science & philosophy in epistémè, tends toward filling in the breach rather than toward forcing the closure (plutôt à colmater les brèches qu’à forcer la clôture)

OG.content: thinking (what we already know we haven’t begun), “mesuré à la taille de l’écriture, s’entame seulement dans l’epistémè” > in a certain manner, thought gives you nothing to say
OG.linkedContent: thinking (what we already know we haven’t begun), “mesuré à la taille de l’écriture, s’entame seulement dans l’epistémè” > in a certain manner, thought gives you nothing to say

OG.content: concept of supplement as blind spot (tache aveugle) in Rousseau: the not seen that opens & limits visibility
OG.linkedContent: concept of supplement as blind spot (tache aveugle) in Rousseau: the not seen that opens & limits visibility

OG.content: that we know this now a priori: not a knowledge at all
OG.linkedContent: that we know this now a priori: not a knowledge at all

OG.content: science, philosophy, epistémè, movement of idealization, privilege of logos is that of phonetic writing, of a more algebraic, economical writing (by reason of certain condition of knowledge): mondial effacement of signifier > one believes one is exalting parole, when in fact, one is fascinated by a figure of technè
OG.linkedContent: science, philosophy, epistémè, movement of idealization, privilege of logos is that of phonetic writing, of a more algebraic, economical writing (by reason of certain condition of knowledge): mondial effacement of signifier > one believes one is exalting parole, when in fact, one is fascinated by a figure of technè

ATAP.content: “Come” precedes & calls event, opens scene, no theme, supports no metalinguistic citation, not an order, not a prayer, not obscurantism—just beyond “What is?” > perhaps where Ereignis and Enteignis unfold movement of propriation
ATAP.linkedContent: “Come” precedes & calls event, opens scene, no theme, supports no metalinguistic citation, not an order, not a prayer, not obscurantism—just beyond “What is?” > perhaps where Ereignis and Enteignis unfold movement of propriation

EU.content: for Kant, that scholars alone can judge other scholars, a tautology: essence of knowledge as knowledge of knowledge
EU.linkedContent: for Kant, that scholars alone can judge other scholars, a tautology: essence of knowledge as knowledge of knowledge

EU.content: State or trans-State capitalist powers, re: storage of information in data banks > once library no longer ideal type of archive: university no longer “guardian” or “trustee” of knowledge (this centralizing representation once constituted mission of university itself)
EU.linkedContent: State or trans-State capitalist powers, re: storage of information in data banks > once library no longer ideal type of archive: university no longer “guardian” or “trustee” of knowledge (this centralizing representation once constituted mission of university itself)

EU.content: fields of publishing, archiving, mediatization have expanded as strikingly as have overcoding & hyper-formalization of language > where does publication begin? [via Kant, publication of knowledge, not knowledge itself, is submitted to authority]
EU.linkedContent: fields of publishing, archiving, mediatization have expanded as strikingly as have overcoding & hyper-formalization of language > where does publication begin? [via Kant, publication of knowledge, not knowledge itself, is submitted to authority]

EU.content: Kant’s strict separation of knowledge (truth) & power (action) distinguishes sets in excess of themselves, covering the whole of which they’re supposed to be only a part > whole forms poche invaginée in every part or subset (sous-ensemble): intestine division, folding partition inside space
EU.linkedContent: Kant’s strict separation of knowledge (truth) & power (action) distinguishes sets in excess of themselves, covering the whole of which they’re supposed to be only a part > whole forms poche invaginée in every part or subset (sous-ensemble): intestine division, folding partition inside space
